sdd-dd:URIParameter.sdd-dd:Description: The name of the system where Common Services Core is installed.
The name of the system where Common Services Core should be deployed.
The name of the target deployment.
The SMP/E Repository where Common Services Core is installed.
A target zone in the source SMP/E Repository where Common Services Core is installed.

To select this feature, You must have the following FMID installed:
CFA9E10 CA-VARIABLE-SERV
If you don't have the FMID installed, the selection will be blocked.
If this selection is blocked, page through the selection list, selecting the products and features you have installed that you wish to deploy.
Individual product selection is not available for products found in the BASE bundle except for MSM CCS.
MSM CCS is now a separate selection in order to support deployment of CETN500 or CETN600. You must select the release of MSM CCS you have installed.
All BASE products must be installed and deployed.
During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.
The deployment process only deploys SMP/E target datasets associated with the FMIDs defined to the product or feature.
You can add non-SMP/E target datasets to be allocated and copied on the target system under the Custom Datasets section.
To add custom datasets, click on the ADD DATASET button then input the dataset information.
If datasets are pre-defined under the custom dataset section, for each dataset listed, update the definition to your site standard by clicking action then edit.
sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:ShortDescription: Additional datasets to deploy with deployable unit CA-Common-Variable-Service

sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:Description:
To select this product, you must have the following FMIDs installed.
CAS9E10 CAIRIM CAW1E10 CAIENF CAW4E10 CAICCI CD0E350 CAECIS CEF5E10 CA-HEALTH-CHECK CEI0E10 CA-MASTER
If you don't have all the FMIDs installed, the selection will be blocked.
If this selection is blocked, page through the selection list, selecting the products and features you have installed that you wish to deploy.
Individual product selection is not available for products found in the BASE bundle except for MSM CCS.
MSM CCS is now a separate selection in order to support deployment of CETN500 or CETN600. You must select the release of MSM CCS you have installed.
All BASE products must be installed and deployed.
During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.
The deployment process only deploys SMP/E target datasets associated with the FMIDs defined to the product or feature.
You can add non-SMP/E target datasets to be allocated and copied on the target system under the Custom Datasets section.
To add custom datasets, click on the ADD DATASET button then input the dataset information.
If datasets are pre-defined under the custom dataset section, for each dataset listed, update the definition to your site standard by clicking action then edit.
sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:ShortDescription: Additional datasets to deploy with deployable unit CommonServices_BASE

sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:Description:
To select this feature, You must have the following FMID installed:
CB6DB30 AGENT-TECHNOLOGY
If you don't have the FMID installed, the selection will be blocked.
If this selection is blocked, page through the selection list, selecting the products and features you have installed that you wish to deploy.
Individual product selection is not available for products found in the BASE bundle except for MSM CCS.
MSM CCS is now a separate selection in order to support deployment of CETN500 or CETN600. You must select the release of MSM CCS you have installed.
All BASE products must be installed and deployed.
During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.
The deployment process only deploys SMP/E target datasets associated with the FMIDs defined to the product or feature.
You can add non-SMP/E target datasets to be allocated and copied on the target system under the Custom Datasets section.
To add custom datasets, click on the ADD DATASET button then input the dataset information.
If datasets are pre-defined under the custom dataset section, for each dataset listed, update the definition to your site standard by clicking action then edit.
USS ZFS CUSTOM DATASET EDITS: 1. The Dataset type should be USS.
2. Confirm that your installation zfs is mounted at the installation mount point specified in the "local path" field.
3. If the custom dataset panel contains the box to Override the Path Naming Standard, see panel help for information concerning this box and how it impacts the Remote Path name.
For the remote path example provided in the next step, the box should NOT be checked. Not checking the box will cause the deployment process to add the lowest level directory found in the local path to the resolved remote path name.
4. Update the "Remote Path" field with the path name you wish to use on the Remote system. The value in this field should not end with / . In this example, the lowest level directory of the Local path name is not specified in the Remote path name field.
Example /YourLocalPathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv/ /YourRemotePathname/CASoftware/CCS
5. Select "Container Copy" as the type of copy.
6. In the Container Name field, specify the name of the remote zfs dataset.
For products with multiple zfs datasets, make sure you are specifying the correct dataset for the path name.
Examples:
For Agent Tech YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RW.CB6DZFS with /YourRemotePathname YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RO.CB6DZFS with /YourRemotePathname/services/bin
Where /YourRemotePathname may be /Your/Remote/Pathname/cai/agent
For Event Management YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RO.CD5IZFS with /YourRemotePathname YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RW.CD5IZFS with /YourRemotePathname/RW
Where /YourRemotePathname may be /Your/Remote/Pathname/cai/nsmem
7. In the Mount Point field, specify the remote mount point. The path name specified in the Mount Point field should be similar to the local path field minus the trailing /.
Only the user modifiable portion of the remote path name should be different from the local path name.
See the previous example to determine the user modifiable portion for AT and EM
Example For the version of Tomcat installed with Common Services /YourLocalPathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv/ /YourRemotePathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv
8. Click OK to end the edit.
sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:ShortDescription: Additional datasets to deploy with deployable unit CommonServices_Agent-Technology

All BASE products must be installed and deployed.
During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.
The deployment process only deploys SMP/E target datasets associated with the FMIDs defined to the product or feature.
You can add non-SMP/E target datasets to be allocated and copied on the target system under the Custom Datasets section.
To add custom datasets, click on the ADD DATASET button then input the dataset information.
If datasets are pre-defined under the custom dataset section, for each dataset listed, update the definition to your site standard by clicking action then edit.
sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:ShortDescription: Additional datasets to deploy with deployable unit CommonServices_GSS

sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:Description:
To select this feature, You must have the following FMID installed:
CBUJE00 CA-L-SERV
If you don't have the FMID installed, the selection will be blocked.
If this selection is blocked, page through the selection list, selecting the products and features you have installed that you wish to deploy.
Individual product selection is not available for products found in the BASE bundle except for MSM CCS.
MSM CCS is now a separate selection in order to support deployment of CETN500 or CETN600. You must select the release of MSM CCS you have installed.
All BASE products must be installed and deployed.
During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.
The deployment process only deploys SMP/E target datasets associated with the FMIDs defined to the product or feature.
You can add non-SMP/E target datasets to be allocated and copied on the target system under the Custom Datasets section.
To add custom datasets, click on the ADD DATASET button then input the dataset information.
If datasets are pre-defined under the custom dataset section, for each dataset listed, update the definition to your site standard by clicking action then edit.

sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:Description:
To select this feature, You must have the following FMID installed:
CEG1E00 TPV-TOMCAT-14.0
If you don't have the FMID installed, the selection will be blocked.
If this selection is blocked, page through the selection list, selecting the products and features you have installed that you wish to deploy.
Individual product selection is not available for products found in the BASE bundle except for MSM CCS.
MSM CCS is now a separate selection in order to support deployment of CETN500 or CETN600. You must select the release of MSM CCS you have installed.
All BASE products must be installed and deployed.
During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.
The deployment process only deploys SMP/E target datasets associated with the FMIDs defined to the product or feature.
You can add non-SMP/E target datasets to be allocated and copied on the target system under the Custom Datasets section.
To add custom datasets, click on the ADD DATASET button then input the dataset information.
If datasets are pre-defined under the custom dataset section, for each dataset listed, update the definition to your site standard by clicking action then edit.
USS ZFS CUSTOM DATASET EDITS: 1. The Dataset type should be USS.
2. Confirm that your installation zfs is mounted at the installation mount point specified in the "local path" field.
3. If the custom dataset panel contains the box to Override the Path Naming Standard, see panel help for information concerning this box and how it impacts the Remote Path name.
For the remote path example provided in the next step, the box should NOT be checked. Not checking the box will cause the deployment process to add the lowest level directory found in the local path to the resolved remote path name.
4. Update the "Remote Path" field with the path name you wish to use on the Remote system. The value in this field should not end with / . In this example, the lowest level directory of the Local path name is not specified in the Remote path name field.
Example /YourLocalPathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv/ /YourRemotePathname/CASoftware/CCS
5. Select "Container Copy" as the type of copy.
6. In the Container Name field, specify the name of the remote zfs dataset.
For products with multiple zfs datasets, make sure you are specifying the correct dataset for the path name.
Examples:
For Agent Tech YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RW.CB6DZFS with /YourRemotePathname YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RO.CB6DZFS with /YourRemotePathname/services/bin
Where /YourRemotePathname may be /Your/Remote/Pathname/cai/agent
For Event Management YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RO.CD5IZFS with /YourRemotePathname YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RW.CD5IZFS with /YourRemotePathname/RW
Where /YourRemotePathname may be /Your/Remote/Pathname/cai/nsmem
7. In the Mount Point field, specify the remote mount point. The path name specified in the Mount Point field should be similar to the local path field minus the trailing /.
Only the user modifiable portion of the remote path name should be different from the local path name.
See the previous example to determine the user modifiable portion for AT and EM
Example For the version of Tomcat installed with Common Services /YourLocalPathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv/ /YourRemotePathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv
8. Click OK to end the edit.
sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:ShortDescription: Additional datasets to deploy with deployable unit TPV_TOMCAT140

sdd-dd:StringParameter.sdd-dd:Description:

MSM CCS is now a separate selection in order to support deployment of CETN500 or CETN600. You must select the release of MSM CCS you have installed.

During the create deployment process, the selection of CommonServices_BASE will automatically select any installed component when all the component's SMP/E target datasets are defined by the components found in CommonServices_BASE.

USS ZFS CUSTOM DATASET EDITS: 1. The Dataset type should be USS.
2. Confirm that your installation zfs is mounted at the installation mount point specified in the "local path" field.
3. If the custom dataset panel contains the box to Override the Path Naming Standard, see panel help for information concerning this box and how it impacts the Remote Path name.
For the remote path example provided in the next step, the box should NOT be checked. Not checking the box will cause the deployment process to add the lowest level directory found in the local path to the resolved remote path name.
4. Update the "Remote Path" field with the path name you wish to use on the Remote system. The value in this field should not end with / . In this example, the lowest level directory of the Local path name is not specified in the Remote path name field.
Example /YourLocalPathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv/ /YourRemotePathname/CASoftware/CCS
5. Select "Container Copy" as the type of copy.
6. In the Container Name field, specify the name of the remote zfs dataset.
For products with multiple zfs datasets, make sure you are specifying the correct dataset for the path name.
Examples:
For Agent Tech YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RW.CB6DZFS with /YourRemotePathname YOUR.REMOTE.HLQ.RO.CB6DZFS with /YourRemotePathname/services/bin
Where /YourRemotePathname may be /Your/Remote/Pathname/cai/agent

Where /YourRemotePathname may be /Your/Remote/Pathname/cai/nsmem
7. In the Mount Point field, specify the remote mount point. The path name specified in the Mount Point field should be similar to the local path field minus the trailing /.
Only the user modifiable portion of the remote path name should be different from the local path name.
See the previous example to determine the user modifiable portion for AT and EM
Example For the version of Tomcat installed with Common Services /YourLocalPathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv/ /YourRemotePathname/CASoftware/CCS/tpv
8. Click OK to end the edit.
